Dialogue.Page: Hello, traveler. Welcome to our village.
Was there something you needed?

DialogueOption.Text: We need your help to open the Great Door.
What have you heard about the fifth shard?

Dialogue.Page: Have you been able to acquire a cockpit?

DialogueOption.Text: Why do you need a cockpit?
I'm having trouble getting you one.

Dialogue.Page: A cockpit! Excellent work. I think our leader will be pleased.
You have been granted an audience with our leader. Allow me to open the doors.
Was there something you needed?

DialogueOption.Text: What have you heard about the fifth shard?

Dialogue.Page: And what reason is there for us to assist you?

DialogueOption.Text: If we all work together we can finally open the door!
Do you want to be the only one between the other clans and opening that door?
Every other clan has agreed to help.
Don't you want to know what's behind that door?

Dialogue.Page: You make a valid point, traveler. That door has remained closed for centuries because of our arrogance.
Even if we were to join you, there is no guarantee that the other clans will wish to do so.
I believe our leader would be willing to join you, however, under one condition.
I would rather not become the target of the other three clans, you are correct in that. The tension between our clans today is already concerningly high.
However, assisting you could also potentially make us a target.
I believe our leader would be willing to risk our clan to help you under one condition.
You put me in a difficult position. I believe I have no choice but to accept.
It is not I who makes the decisions, however. It is ultimately up to our leader to make the decision of whether we join you.
I believe our leader would be willing to join under one condition.
You are correct, traveler. There is not one species on this planet who does not wonder what secrets the Great Door holds.
It is our arrogance and hatred for each other that keeps us from satisfying that curiosity. If I were the one to make the decision, I would say it is time for us to change our ways.
Sadly, I am not the one who makes the decisions. You will need to consult our leader about your request.
To gain an audience with him, there is something you will need to do first.
The extent of my knowledge is that the fifth shard was lost somewhere on this planet.
Perhaps if you gain an audience with our leader he will be able to tell you more.
Our clan has recently begun conducting a study on alien manufacturing of spacecraft in an effort to further improve our own constructions.
If you could provide us with a cockpit, our leader may be convinced into giving you our shard.

DialogueOption.Text: I'll get you one in no time!
I'll see what I can do.

Dialogue.Page: Excellent. Goodbye, and good luck.
I have faith in your abilites. Good luck.
There is no point to our studies on alien technology if there is no technology to study!
Perhaps, when we finally do construct a spacecraft, we will invite you to see it.
But first, we will need a cockpit. I trust you will find one successfully.
I believe you will be able to find one without my assistance.
In the case that you were planning to bring an entire ship here, I will inform you now; we are only accepting the cockpit of a ship.
Good luck.
